alert.note: Alert for Lubbock (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 03 at 4:08PM CDT until October 04 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Double Mountain Fork Brazos near Lubbock 4ESE affecting Lubbock County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is expected to occur. * WHERE...Double Mountain Fork Brazos near Lubbock 4ESE. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...Flooding over FM-835 just west of Buffalo Springs is still occurring with 1.5 feet of water over the roadway with some areas as high as 2 feet deep. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 8.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...No forecast stage exists. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.6 feet on 06/04/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at midnight CDT.
